catalog_info.title: Applied Linear Algebra and Big Data
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Applied Mathematics 21a,b or equivalent, programming experience.
catalog_info.description: Topics in linear algebra which arise frequently in applications, including in the analysis of large data sets: linear equations, eigenvalue problems, principal component analysis, singular value decomposition, quadratic forms, linear inequalities, linear programming, optimization, linear differential equations, modeling and prediction, data mining methods including frequent pattern analysis, classification, clustering, outlier detection.  Examples will be given from physical sciences, biology, climate, commerce, internet, imageprocessing, economics and more.
